page.title: 01Summary
page.content: }Our area is part of the Roding River Valley. It is given over to agriculture- mainly cereals. Some animals are kept - sheep and pigs.There are a very few minor industrial concerns. It is sparsely populated; the majority of residents are commuters or retired people. It is within the Green Belt area and within easy access of London. There is one main road which runs through it (B 184) from Fyfield to Dunmow. The scenery is rolling and slightly undulating with typically pleasing Essex views. The Dutch Elm disease of a few years ago virtually wiped out one very common tree - the Elm. The area is the habitat of many common birds as well as the Red- backed Shrike which is nesting in the
